intro: Centromadia pungens var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth centromadia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in white or pale yellow. The plant is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The species is also noted for its ability to tolerate a range of soil types, making it adaptable to various ecological niches.
